intro: Rhodiola iremelica, commonly known as the King's Crown, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of fleshy, dark green leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant thrives in cold, arid environments and is adapted to high altitudes with limited soil nutrients. Rhodiola iremelica is known for its resilience and ability to survive in harsh climatic conditions. Its botanical features make it a unique subject of study in alpine ecology and plant adaptation.
